snippet: As the conflict ground on with heavy shelling in Idlib, Kofi Annan, a former secretary general, said he was optimistic about the possibility of a deal to end the fighting.
abstract: United Nations envoy Kofi Annan leaves Damascus, Syria, without securing a deal to end the nearly year-old conflict, but remains optimistic about the possibility of an agreement; UN estimates that the widening war has killed at least 7,500 people.
lead_paragraph: As the conflict ground on with heavy shelling in Idlib, Kofi Annan, a former secretary general, said he was optimistic about the possibility of a deal to end the fighting.

headline.seo: U.N. Envoy Leaves Syria Without Deal to End Conflict
headline.print_headline: U.N. Envoy Leaves Damascus Without Peace Deal

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
